thread.title: Pronto revamps core software
thread.title_full: Pronto revamps core software | Business Spectator

author: Jennifer Foreshew
title: Pronto revamps core software
text:
Australian technology company Pronto Software has announced a complete redesign of its flagship ERP and analytics platform Pronto Xi to make the solution faster and easier to use.
The company has unveiled its cloud-focused solution Pronto Xi 730, which is accessible on any device. It features a new web interface with seamless access to Pronto Xi from devices with a web connection through a secure cloud functionality.
Pronto Software chief operating officer Chad Gates said the solution offered a more intuitive display of information that improved productivity.
“We have provided a fresh, clean user interface while retaining and improving on the extremely fast, efficient user experience that our users are used to,’’ he told The Australian.
“We have also made the upgrade path very smooth for existing users.’’
Mr Gates said the new web interface provided a reliable and secure user experience.
“We see that customers are demanding more from the software, they are expecting it to be a lot easier to use and they are expecting it to deliver real benefits really quickly.’’
Users can access Pronto Xi away from their usual desk environment with no additional training necessary.
Mr Gates said cloud innovation was a key focus area for the business with 65 per cent of customers choosing Pronto’s SaaS platform.
“It is normal now for people to be transacting or operating in the cloud or on a mobile device so it is only natural that a system like Pronto Xi, which is a high-volume transactional system with embedded business intelligence capabilities, is available in that same medium.’’
Pronto Software, which has 380 staff in Australia and works with more than 1600 customers and partners globally, invests more than 12 per cent of its turnover year-on-year into research and development for its flagship product.
“I would suggest we will probably see a couple of hundred customers upgrading in the next 12 months at least,’’ Mr Gates said.
He said user design standards were being pushed along by Google and others with cloud-based services changing expectations.
“There are a few key bits of functionality in there that are important and one of them is integration, for example, to cloud-based services such as Google Apps for Work and Office 365.’’
Other Pronto Xi 730 innovation includes simpler general ledger hierarchies to deliver faster period end processing with out-of-the-box reports and allowing users to easily set up data structures to produce custom financial reports in minutes.
The seamless integration with Pronto Xi CRM, sales and inventory modules, mobile sales offers a complete customer profile view; the ability to make real-time sales transactions and a powerful dashboard to track sales progress.
The enhanced Pronto Xi project application makes it easier to manage projects by activity and duration. View percentage completion and status of each task to gain more accuracy and insight into a project’s progress. Integrated procurement gives project managers more control at project kick off with the automated purchase orders and work orders.
The solution features mobile service with on-site invoicing and payment receipting for faster call-to-cash process. It also includes an employee portal to streamline many administrative tasks such as time sheet entry and leave management.
“The feedback we have received so far is that it feels and goes quicker,’’ Mr Gates said.
